hooks.prompt: Evaluate if this session involved Hyper terminal work (editing .hyper.js, creating Hyper plugins, troubleshooting Hyper issues, or discussing Hyper configuration). If YES: ask the user if there are learnings to capture, and if they provide any, append to ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/.cache/learnings.md Learnings section with date prefix [YYYY-MM-DD] under categories 'Successful Patterns', 'Mistakes to Avoid', or 'Plugin Patterns', then return {"ok": true}. If NO Hyper work was done: return ONLY {"ok": true} with no other text.
